location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: File is arranged in chronological order, from earliest at beginning of the file to most recent at end.

Condition: A bound correspondence volume.Foliation: The file's main foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. A second foliation sequence is present between ff. 2-35; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and can be found in the same position as the main sequence.The file contains the following foliation errors: 1, 1A, 1B, 1C, 1D and 1E.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials regarding the status of the border between Iraq and Kuwait following the Iraqi Government expressing an interest in applying for admission to the League of Nations in Geneva. The officials also discuss a recent incident in which a board marking the border had been removed by the Iraqi authorities.The file contains correspondence between British Officials and the Iraqi Prime Minister, Nūrī al-Sa‘īd as well as with Shaikh Aḥmad al-Jābir Āl Ṣabāḥ, the ruler of Kuwait. In the correspondence, British officials state that the status of the border needs to be approved before Iraq can formally apply to join the League of Nations.
